newsitem.title: USA: Cyprus Amax says payment owed may be delayed.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus Amax says payment owed may be delayed.

text.p: Cyprus Amax Minerals Co said Tuesday the resulting income effect for the $70 million payment due under a prior restructuring agreement for discontinued coal purchases would be delayed until early 1997 due to unknown timing and/or regulatory approval.

The agreement in which Central Illinois Public Service Co, a subsidiary of CIPSCO Inc, would discontinue coal purchases from the Delta mine in Illinois included a payment of $70 million to Cyprus Amax.
The company said that it ceased snipping coal from the Delta mine, which it closed in August 1996 due to high cost structure and limited marketing opportunities.
It said that Central Illinois was proceeding with its petition to change to low sulfur coal and recover the payment from its ratepayers.
